title: The Asus ROG Phone 7 has a giant active cooling backpack, two USB ports
content:
• The Asus ROG Phone 7. This is the Ultimate model. [credit: Asus ]

Some companies may be giving up on the idea of Android gaming phones, but not Asus, which is releasing the ROG Phone 7 today. It has all the trademark "gamer" laser-beam design language and pointless LEDs, but also some really wild engineering additions when it comes to cooling your super-hot gaming phone.

Specs include a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 SoC, 16GB of RAM, 512GB of storage, and—the highlight of the spec sheet—a whopping 6000 mAh battery with 65 W charging. The display is a 165 Hz,  6.78-inch, 2448×1080 Samsung AMOLED. The phone has two USB-C ports, one on the side and one on the bottom, along with a headphone jack. There are three rear cameras, a 50 MP main camera, a 13 MP wide-angle, and a 5 MP macro, while the front camera is 32 MP.

There are two models here, the ROG Phone 7 and ROG Phone 7 Ultimate. The specs are the same; the ultimate just adds a rear "ROG Vision" display. This is a 2-inch OLED display with six different modes to show things like the time, charging level, an incoming call, or a few purely aesthetic animations. The Ultimate model also interfaces better with a clip-on fan accessory, the "AeroActive Cooler 7."
